title: Approximations
alt: Two tips: 1) 8675309 is not just prime, it's a twin prime, and 2) if you ever find yourself raising log(anything)^e or taking the pi-th root of anything, set down the marker and back away from the whiteboard; something has gone horribly wrong.

Intermission: World Population Estimate which should stay current for a decade or two:
Take the last two digits of the current year
Example: 20[14] 
Subtract the number of leap years since hurricane Katrina
Example: 14 (minus 2008 and 2012) is 12
Add a decimal point
Example: 1.2
Add 6
Example: 6 + 1.2
7.2 = World population in billions.

Version for US population:
Example: 20[14]
Subtract 10
Example: 4
Multiply by 3
Example: 12
Add 10
Example: 3[22] million
